question: If the optic nerve (II) or olfactory tract is interrupted, will it regenerate? <image 1>
description: The image shows a close-up view of the base of the brain, specifically focusing on the region where the optic nerves (II) emerge from the brain. The optic nerves are highlighted with green arrows pointing to them. The surrounding structures include the pituitary gland and other cranial nerves. The image provides a clear view of the optic nerves as they exit the brainstem and enter the orbit through the optic canal.
